channel.title: Chemistry A level papers
channel.description: Well yesterday my sister came and told me to download all the exam papers from [url=http://freeexampapers.com/Dndex.php?d=QSBMZXZlbC9DaGVtaXN0cnkvRWRleGNlbA==]here[/url] and p[ut on her usb. But seeing as there are so many of them, it'd be real pain to download each of them. So I remember there being softwares to rip files off from websites but is there any that can do the same for pdfs? :S Anyone know anyway where I can bulk download this stuff? I need to get this done by tomrw

item.title: Chemistry A level papers
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“akl, post:14, topic:329426”]Those are OCR, Cambridge.
But thanks for the attempt mate.[/quote]
Oh I didn’t really check them out. I’m sure they’re out there in torrents, there are torrent websites dedicated to A-level etc and won’t be hard to find.

[quote=“Eh Pretty Easy, post:15, topic:329426”][quote author=akl link=topic=425815.msg3130242#msg3130242 date=1266419481]
Those are OCR, Cambridge.
But thanks for the attempt mate.
[/quote]I thought the A-level exams are from Cambridge…[/quote]
They’re from various different boards - not only cambridge.

Read full topic

item.title: Chemistry A level papers
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“akl, post:12, topic:329426”][quote author=chri5 link=topic=425815.msg3128587#msg3128587 date=1266241168]

As far as I know, edexcel’s A level chemistry spec is new and this is the first year for exams for it.

not the latest ones obviously.

@abraham2119 and Unhandled,
could you guys explain a little more?

Read the wget manual.
[/quote]
I downloaded it and set it up too, doesn’t really fit my needs
ah damn, I’ll just have to do it manually then.[/quote]
Here you go http://www.torrentreactor.net/torrents/715505/Past-A-level-chemistry-papers-exams(edexcel)
What I meant earlier was that there’s a new spec for chemistry and there are no past papers for the new spec.

Read full topic

item.title: Chemistry A level papers
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

Just make an application yourself that uses regex to parse all links from the site and download them. It shouldn’t make any difference whether it’s a PDF or not as long as you are downloading all files through binary.

Read full topic

@chri5 wrote:

[quote=“akl, post:1, topic:329426”]Well yesterday my sister came and told me to download all the exam papers from here and p[ut on her usb.
But seeing as there are so many of them, it’d be real pain to download each of them.
So I remember there being softwares to rip files off from websites but is there any that can do the same for pdfs? :S
Anyone know anyway where I can bulk download this stuff? I need to get this done by tomrw[/quote]
Get the source from the main page, get all of the links from each page, download all the end in .pdf, do the same for all the other pages.
